DOC.HEAD: London Shares End Sharply Higher
Eds: UPDATES with close
DOC.TEXT: Share prices on the London Stock Exchange ended sharply higher Wednesday in thin trading. Dealers said buying mainly reflected interest from fund managers who wanted to add to portfolios before yearend. The Financial Times-Stock Exchange 100-share index ended 33.8 points, or 1.4 percent, higher at 2,395.8 points. Trading volume was 223.3 million shares, down from 375.3 million shares Friday, when the market closed early. Sentiment was positive on the first trading day in London after the four-day holiday weekend. But many market players already have closed their books for the year and moved to the sidelines until next week.
